instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins high for a second and then turns off
threads.message:
Im currently working on an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wich boost to 20v and draw approx. 1.7A. Fans spin up normal for around 10 seconds. then the fans do a burst and the Macbook restarts.
It had minior liquid damage near j5100, <CHIP>U5104</CHIP>, . I have already tried:

- Disconnecting everything except battery. (since it doesn't boot without it) and one usb-c port adapter.

My guess is, that it is a temp. sensor. (maybe the one in the battery ?)

What do you guys think?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins high for a second and then turns off
threads.message: Do you get correct <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> without battery connected?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins high for a second and then turns off
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins high for a second and then turns off
threads.message: without battery trackpad clicks, but fans don't spin. Is that how its supposed to be?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins high for a second and then turns off
threads.message:
Fan will start later I supposed.
Did you check for USB activity?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins high for a second and then turns off
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins high for a second and then turns off
threads.message:
Try DFU restore.
Search the forum, several threads available.
May not be easy to get it at first attempt.
Read what other members commented...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins high for a second and then turns off
threads.message: i have found the problem: it was the battery cable. One Trace had no connection. After replacing it, it works just fine. Still thanks
